item.title: Tip: calling all methods in an Object in Ruby
item.description: In Ruby, you can query the methods an object accepts: pry(main)> 1.methods => [:to_s, :-@, :+, :-, :*, :/, :div, :%, :modulo, :divmod, :fdiv, ... In case you want to call all methods, this can be useful (plus its tests): def call_all_methods(object, *args) # remove methods that modify the PRY environment or are too verbose success = {} error = {} exclusions = [:pry, :methods, :private_methods, :public_methods, :gem].map { |x| x.
